instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
Having a right shit night of it tonight! 

Have this mac air, it was a trade in from a customer had a damaged screen, I replaced the screen cleaned it installed monterey and had it up for sale for weeks.  Got a call from someone today that wanted it, so took it from the shelf to give it a clean and get it ready. Won't fkin turn on! 

It worked perfectly before I even used it for browsing the net for a couple of weeks. 

I get fan spin and both green and orange light on charger,  no bong no display, nothing on external display and I can't seem to get any USB activity. 
Voltages all look good so went over the usual suspects and find <RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR> /<RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> are bad, I've replaced these but still the same symptoms, I got fed up with it at one stage today and walked off leaving it with plugged in, came back 2 hours later and it was at a login screen! Yey I shout. Shut it down clean it, now same thing again it just won't boot, fan spin, lights on magsafe no display,

Any ideas?

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
Do you get VCORE and <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?
If not, check <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
Do you get VCORE and <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>? = No
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.   = No again.,

With the board on the bench to test voltages I get green then orange light on charger but no fan spin., But if I put the board back in the case and connect the battery I do get fan spin! and all main power rails seem to be there, I can read good voltages on all coils but no boing and no screen,

Shouldn't this board auto turn on with battery disconnected?

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
Yeah, it should.
But you didn't specify which voltages appear on the MLB alone on the desk.
What about <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS at least?
Did you test with original 45/60W Magsafe 2 charger?

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
Using original apple 45w magsafe 2, 
  <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS  both at 3.31v

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>.
Be sure <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> is steady high.

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
Connecting an oldf keyboard to trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>,. I do get drop pulse on  <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>  and fan starts to spin

<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> is steady is a steady 3.30v

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
You don't need keyboard to trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>; didn't see <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads?

If fan starts to spin, more voltages should be present; check on the big coils.
Is good to use an USB tester.

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
I Normally use  <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16  after U showed me these but sometimes when trying to measure you have to be a bit of an octopus! having a few old keyboards with working power button make it a bit easier sometimes,

Still seems to power on, Just no bong no display,.
Measured coils


L2920 = 1.0V
L7750 =5.1V
L3130 = 8.33V
L3095 =1.4 mV??
L7701 =3.6 mV ??
L7520 = 5.08V
L7560 = 3.16V
L7430 = 1.214V
L7630 =1.063V
L7320 = 1.783V
L7310 = 1.785V

Do you use the one Harold sells? been thinking of getting this? any other of his tools worth me getting as it seems daft just ordering the USB tester alone?

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
I have Harald USB tester and I use it daily.

As you now get VCORE, let us know about <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.

BTW, soldering a small push button on <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads, is the best way to test the board alone on the desk; use 5-10cm wires for connection.

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
Going to order from Harold today!

And get a couple of push buttons., thanks

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> both at 3.30v with fan spinning.

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
Still no video?
Test external video and use a pendrive with Link LED for USB activity.

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
Still NO video on internal or external, 
USB has power but no activity.

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
Be sure J6100 is clean.
Try known good BIOS.
Also check all voltages from pages 11 & 58.

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
Be sure J6100 is clean.
Try known good BIOS.
Also check all voltages from pages 11 & 58.

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
[B]That should keep me busy :ROFLMAO:

II tried to try a fresh bios but I just keep getting a weird error message on the madusa when tyring to write a clean bios file.. Seems to read it OK. Have you encountered this before? [/B]

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
Turn off the MLB using <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads, after Medusa is connected.
Keep it in S5 state.

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
Went to give this a go last night but. 

Last time I tried it I had 2 other Airs on my shelf with the same logic board that I pulled the bios from, I now dont have these and stupidly diddnt save the bios dump to the PC. Do you have agood bios for this I could try please?

Thanks in advance,.

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
This is really odd! after you mentioned check J6100 is clean I thought id just have a look at it under the scope, |"Board in case"

Looks immaculate! but whilst there I turn on using  <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/  pads, and it goes BOING and boots into desktop shocked I go to the kitchen and make a coffe.

On return its screen has gone off and its doing a quarter fan spin, So I power it off and try again, now back to original problem again, no matter what is or isnt connected or how I power it on I just get fan spin no boing no display, 

Does this give us any more clues as to whats going on here?

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
Heat PCH/CPU with quality flux.
May have luck to be a problem caused by accumulated crap.

You can also try reballing SMC.

threads.title: 00165-a
threads.message:
Heated PCH and SMC with Amtech flux, Board looked a mess so ran it through the Ultrasonic,
Put back together and it booted fine and ran perfectly.

Half an hour later wouldn't turn on, couldn't even get a fan spin this time it just looked dead,

removed heat sink again loads more flux and a little more heat for a little longer on just the PCH, Cleaned up put back together and its been working perfectly all evening!

Crap under PCH maybe?

Let's see if it turns on in the morning ;)
